name: Deposition - A new start? (Monologues)
description: A reflection on the course of western civilization, this work focuses on the paradoxical fusion of Ancient Greek/Roman and Christian values and beliefs, still present in our contemporary way of life. Nietzsche often pointed out the antithesis of these two systems of thought in order to attack the influence Christianity had in western society, as did the giant of modern Greek literature, Nikos Kazantzakis. The lumberjack, an incarnation of Zarathustra or Zorbas (the true Nietzschean Übermensch) is an outsider, a seeker of truth, a ravager of cognitive biases, confidently chopping down the ideological totems of contradiction; the superstructure of guilt, power and reward that entagle us all in their webs. Setting a blank slate for new hopeful beginnings.
